channel.title: Black Mesa 2012 vs. Black Mesa 2015 Image Comparisons
channel.description:
Hey everyone! I wanted to see directly the difference between the 2012 version of Black Mesa and the 2015 version, so I took some comparison pics. I tried to get them as close as possible using the setpos commands, but in some cases the coordinates appear to be slightly different.
Here are what I have so far, I'll continue to add them as I do more. [img]https://cdn.makeagif.com/media/5-09-2015/A9xvxU.gif[/img] Here you can see that the 2015 version has a darker tone and nicer lighting. Original Images: 2012 - [url]https://imgur.com/dgSbC3K[/url] 2015 - [url]https://imgur.com/XmSeGdk[/url]
[img]https://cdn.makeagif.com/media/5-09-2015/J7Jf4U.gif[/img] In this comparison you can see the addition of vegetation that helps break up the scene and some better lighting on some of the rock formations. Props to Dale for this! Original Images: 2012 - [url]https://imgur.com/eMwt8yp[/url] 2015 - [url]https://imgur.com/gMdSXaJ[/url]
[img]https://cdn.makeagif.com/media/5-09-2015/gZqMaQ.gif[/img] In this scene you can see some major changes took place. There's better lighting overall, the props have been replaced with much higher detail models, the catwalk was giving some stairs. Overall this scene is much nicer looking than its 2012 counterpart. Original Images: 2012 - [url]https://imgur.com/WvTpKax[/url] 2015 - [url]https://imgur.com/Iktpm6x[/url]
[img]https://cdn.makeagif.com/media/5-09-2015/yQ1w-s.gif[/img] Again in this scene, a lot of props received some touch ups, the most obvious change is the ventilation units on the ceiling. And again you can see much better lighting here, especially in the corners. Original Images: 2012 - [url]https://imgur.com/avFIL6A[/url] 2015 - [url]https://imgur.com/RPUnQUq[/url]
[img]https://cdn.makeagif.com/media/5-09-2015/Wduw_x.gif[/img] Here you can see every prop has been given a major detail upgrade, and some lighting changes such as the addition of an accent light along the back wall. Original Images: 2012 - [url]https://imgur.com/n7WZa4N[/url] 2015 - [url]https://imgur.com/glrjB0B[/url]
[img]https://cdn.makeagif.com/media/5-09-2015/jaUD7t.gif[/img] Here you can see the cabinets were replaced with models, giving them handles. The fume hood was also replaced with a model, and we see more lighting changes here as well. Original Images: 2012 - [url]https://imgur.com/ONlPgRL[/url] 2015 - [url]https://imgur.com/jHyqh7h[/url]
I'll be adding more of these to this thread as I get around to them!

item.dc:creator: Xeoxer
item.description:
Deathmonkey7:
Tuskin38:

There is a site you can use, you can upload them there, and when people hover their mouse over the image it will change to the alternate you uploaded. Looks a lot better then a compressed gif.

https://screenshotcomparison.com/

Oh man, that’s perfect! I was looking for a site like that thanks! And with that, here are some more

https://screenshotcomparison.com/comparison/126244/picture:0

Click the tabs at the top to switch to different comparison shots.

These go through Office Complex and WGH

Comparison 1 shows off some newly detailed doors, and much better pipe textures.

Comparison 2 shows off a different direction in lighting that makes the scene a bit moodier, plus a newly modeled entry door to the freezer in OC.

Comparison 3 shows off another change in lighting, losing the eerie green color, plus another newly modeled freezer door.

Comparison 4 shows off the new security terminals.

The third one actually has a headcrab clipping issue that wasn’t present in 2012. But aside from that, I didn’t even notice these small changes on my playthrough, well done BM team!

item.title: Black Mesa 2012 vs. Black Mesa 2015 Image Comparisons
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
Here are some weapon comparisons. I left out several that didn’t have any obvious changes to them.


The crowbar in Black Mesa 2015 is thinner than the 2012 version, Gordon’s hands are further down.


The Glock in 2015 has a wider sight in the back, a different skin, and is positioned a little closer to the center of the screen.


The MP5 has added side rails, some extra details near the stock, and a shorter barrel.


The rocket launcher got a total overhaul, with the scope now on the side (where it makes sense), much better details such as buttons, and a better looking screen.


The Tau gun also got a major overhaul, with almost nothing resembling the original. The C batteries were replaced with double A’s, the coil is no longer exposed near the front. The tubes in the front now have jigglebones, overall an awesome upgrade.

item.title: Black Mesa 2012 vs. Black Mesa 2015 Image Comparisons
item.dc:creator: jadebenn
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

We did a whole bunch of stuff, though I’m not sure exactly what. AO was the biggest one, and I think that was written by us, or adapted from Valve. Either way, it’s quite a big improvement visually.

That and we’re hopefully soon going to have some more new, super cool graphical features which will take outdoor areas to the next level. Hopefully!

Personally, I’m just glad I can get some good AO in source. manually enabling SSAO looked godawful (the AO rendered in broad daylight and through smoke), and VRAD tended to make corners way too bright.
